member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalCacheConfig
member.summary: A configuration object use to configure creation of a local cache.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalCacheConfig.BatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the local view batch size which will be used for synchronizing the view with the remote space. Null value indicates that the default value will be used.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalCacheConfig.BatchTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the local view batch timeout (i.e. maximum time the server will batch entries before updating the client. Null value indicates that the default value will be used.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalCacheConfig.MaxDisconnectionDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed duration to hold stale data in the view before restarting the view. This occurrs when the connection is lost with the remote space for the specified duration. Null value indicates that the default value will be used.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Change.Extensions.ChangeExtension.AddAndGet``1(GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy,GigaSpaces.Core.IdQuery{``0},System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Atomically adds the given value to the current value of an entry's property.
member.param: the proxy to the space which stores the entry.
id the query which is used to locate the entry.
the path to the number property which is being modified.
the value to add.
member.returns: the updated value, null of no matching entry found for the given id query. Therefore you must use the primitive nullable types as the result value (e.g. int?/long?) otherwise you may get an exception if no entry was found.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Dump.IDumpProvider.GenerateDump(System.String)
member.summary: Generates dump for all the provided dump processors. Note, this will include a heap dump which can consume time and potentially be of very large size
member.param: The cause that this dump was generated
member.returns: A dump result.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Dump.IDumpProvider.GenerateDump(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary:
Generates dump for the provided processors. The current list of processors include:
summary: General summary information of the process.
network: Information on the network layer of the process and the OS network stats.
thread: Thread dump of the process.
heap: Heap dump of the process. Note, this is a heavy operation and can produce very large dump files
log: Adds all the log files of the process to the dump file.
processingUnits: Dump of all the processing units (applicable only for GSCs) information.
member.param: The cause this dump was generated.
The list of processors to be used.
member.returns: A dump result.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Gateway.IGatewayDelegator
member.summary: A gateway delegator is used to delegate outgoing replication packets to other gateways. Acts as a communication connector such that a local space and relevant components need only to find the delegator locally in order to communicate with a remote gateway. Delegators can be chained together to create a multi-hop delegation between gateways.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Gateway.IGatewaySink
member.summary: A sink is a component which handles incoming replication from other gateways. The sink is also used to bootstrap a space from another space, and it takes part in both sides of the bootstrap process. It is used for initiating a bootstrap process and replicate incoming data of the bootstrap process to the local . And it is used to respond to a remote bootstrap request by providing the relevant bootstrap data to the remote sink.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Gateway.IGatewaySink.EnableIncomingReplication
member.summary: Enables incoming replication for this sink, only relevant if this sink and no bootstrap was executed yet, otherwise the sink incoming replication is already enabled.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IServiceGridAdmin
member.summary:
The main interface for accessing Service Grid Admin API. Created using the class.
Provides access to the main elements in the Service Grid Admin API and in GigaSpaces such as the , , , , , and .
Also allows to change monitoring (not statistics) interval (works in a polling fashion) of state changing elements such as the processing unit, the Grid Service Agent, and the Space.
Implements the interface, allowing in one single call () to start statistics monitors on all the elements it manages (such as the {}, and .

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IStatisticsMonitor
member.summary: Components implement this interface indicating that they can be monitored for statistics. Components will allow to get their respective statistics without being monitoring (while caching the calls for the provided statistics interval). Monitoring statistics is only required when wanting to receive statistics change events. The statistics interval controls either for how long the latest statistics call will be cached, or, when monitoring is enabled, the interval the statistics will be pooled. Its default value is 5 seconds.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IStatisticsMonitor.SetStatisticsInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the statistics interval, automatically updating the monitoring scheduled tasks if monitoring is enabled.
member.param: Specify the statistics sampling interval.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IStatisticsMonitor.SetStatisticsHistorySize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of history statistics record to store.
member.param: Number of history statistics record to store.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IStatisticsMonitor.StartStatisticsMonitor
member.summary: Starts the statistics monitor, starting a scheduled monitor that polls for statistics. Monitoring is required only when wanting to receive statistics change events.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IStatisticsMonitor.StopStatisticsMonitor
member.summary: Stops the statistics monitor.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IStatisticsMonitor.Monitoring
member.summary: Gets whether statistics are currently being monitored.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IServiceGridAdmin.SetProcessingUnitMonitorInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the processing unit monitor (not statistics) interval. The monitor basically checks the status of each processing unit (} among other things.
Defaults to 1 second.
member.param: The interval to use.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IServiceGridAdmin.SetAgentProcessessMonitorInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the Grid Service Agent processes monitor (not statistics) interval. The monitor basically updates the list of processes the agent manages ().
Defaults to 5 seconds.
member.param: The interval to use.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IServiceGridAdmin.SetSpaceMonitorInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the Space monitor (not statistics) interval. The monitor checks each space instance and updates its different status (such as the replication status).
Defaults to 1 second.
member.param: The interval to use.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IServiceGridAdmin.SetSchedulerCorePoolSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: The Admin uses a shared scheduler thread pool to perform *all* scheduled operations (monitoring, statistics monitoring). The number of threads used can be set here. Defaults to 10 threads.
member.param: The number of threads the shared scheduler thread pool will use.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.IServiceGridAdmin.SetDefaultTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: The default timeout to be used for operations that have a wait for mechanism, i.e. operations with overloaded methods containing (..., TimeSpan timeout). If not set, the default is wait for ever.
member.param: The timeout value to be used as the default operation timeout if non was provided.

Grid Service Managers hold all the different s that are currently discovered.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Memcached.MemcachedDeployment.MaxInstancesPerVM(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of instances per virtual machine.
On partitioned topology with backups topology, controls that a primary and a backup won't run on the same virtual machine if set to 1.
On a non partitioned with backups topology, controls the maximum number of instances running on the same virtual machine.
member.param: The maximum instances per virtual machine.
member.returns: The set with the specified maximum instances per virtual machine.

member.summary:

On partitioned topology with backups topology, controls that a primary and a backup won't run on the same machine if set to 1.
On a non partitioned with backups topology, controls the maximum number of instances running on the same machine.
member.param: The maximum instances per machine.
member.returns: The set with the specified maximum instances per machine.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Memcached.MemcachedDeployment.MaxInstancesPerZone(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of instances per zone.
On partitioned topology with backups topology, controls that a primary and a backup won't run on the same zone if set to 1. Note, for each zone this will have to be set.
On a non partitioned with backups topology, controls the maximum number of instances running on he same zone.
member.param: The zone to set maximum instances for.
The maximum instances per zone.
member.returns: The set with the specified maximum instances per zone for a specific zone.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.OperatingSystem.IOperatingSystems
member.summary:
Machines hold all the different s that are currently discovered.
Provides simple means to get all the current operating systems, as well as as registering for operating system lifecycle (added and removed) events.
Provides the ability to start monitoring statistics in a polling fashion. Once monitoring is performed, a statistics event can be listened in order to receive statistics change events.
When starting to monitor for statistics, each will also start its statistics monitoring, and newly discovered ones will also start monitoring for statistics automatically.

member.summary: Undeploys the processing unit.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.ProcessingUnit.IProcessingUnit.UndeployAndWait
member.summary:
Undeploys the processing unit and waits until all instances have been undeployed. In case of an Elastic processing unit, also waits for containers to shutdown.
The undeployment process will return when all processing units have undeployed or have elapsed.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.ProcessingUnit.IProcessingUnit.UndeployAndWait(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Undeploys the processing unit and waits until all instances have been undeployed. In case of an Elastic processing unit, also waits for containers to shutdown.
The undeployment process will wait for the given timeout and return when all processing units have undeployed or timeout expired.
member.param: Time to wait.
member.returns: True if undeploy completed successfully within the specified timeout. False if undeploy is still in progress.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.ProcessingUnit.IProcessingUnit.MaxInstancesPerVM
member.summary: Gets the number of instances of this processing unit that can run within a VM. In case of a partitioned with backup topology, it applies on a per partition level (meaning that a primary and backup will not run on the same VM). In case of a non backup based topology, it applies on the number of instances of the whole processing unit that can run on the same VM).

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.ProcessingUnit.IProcessingUnit.MaxInstancesPerMachine
member.summary: Returns the number of instnaces of this processing unit that can run within a Machine. In case of a partitioned with backup topology, it applies on a per partition level (meaning that a primary and backup will not run on the same Machine). In case of a non backup based topology, it applies on the number of instances of the whole processing unit that can run on the same Machine).

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.ProcessingUnit.IProcessingUnitInstance.Restart
member.summary:
Restarts the processing unit instance. Note, if this instance is running an embedded space instance, and the space instance is primary and there is a backup around as well, this method is handy to "turn" the backup to primary.
Note, the current processing unit instance is unusable once this call has been made. If the restarted processing unit instance is needed, or waiting for the restart is required, use or .

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.Mirror.IMirrorOperationStatistics
member.summary: Represents specific mirror operation statistics. In a cluster that is active the numbers should be used as an estimation only, since statistics gathering is concurrent. In a cluster that does not have any activity the numbers are accurate. The statistics should comply to the following formula : operationCount = successfulCount + failedCount + discardedCount. This formula will not have an exact fit in active cluster and should be used as an estimation only.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.Mirror.IMirrorStatistics
member.summary:
Interface for mirror operation statistics. All mirror operations are executed in bulks. Each bulk can contain several operations that can be one of the following: , , . MirrorStatistics shows the total operation statistics, specific replication channel statistics and also statistics per operation - //. Mirror Channels statistics shows only operations that belong to specific space. This might be useful when monitoring a connection between specific space and the mirror.
To get information about what is sent to the mirror by the cluster spaces, use the API.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.ISpace
member.summary:
A space is composed of several s the form a topology.
There are two main logical of topologies, one that has backups to each space instance, and one that is without backups. For example, a partitioned topology of 2 partitions, each with one backup will return 2 for and 1 for . A replicated topology of 4 will return 4 for and 0 for . A Space will be discovered once one of its s have been discovered. It will be removed once there are no s running. Provides the ability to start a statistics monitor on all current s using . Newly discovered space instances will automatically use the statistics monitor as well.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.ISpaceInstance
member.summary:
A Space Instance is a single instance of a space running as a part of a space.
For example, when deploying a 2 partitions each with one backup topology, there will be 4 space instances running.

The number of space instances the deployment will have.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.SpaceDeployment.NumberOfBackups(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of backups per instance of the space deployment.
member.param: The number of backups per instance to set for the space deployment.
member.returns: The set with the specified number of backups.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.SpaceDeployment.MaxInstancesPerVM(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of instances per virtual machine.
On partitioned topology with backups topology, controls that a primary and a backup won't run on the same virtual machine if set to 1.
On a non partitioned with backups topology, controls the maximum number of instances running on the same virtual machine.
member.param: The maximum instances per virtual machine.
member.returns: The set with the specified maximum instances per virtual machine.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.SpaceDeployment.MaxInstancesPerMachine(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of instances per machine.
On partitioned topology with backups topology, controls that a primary and a backup won't run on the same machine if set to 1.
On a non partitioned with backups topology, controls the maximum number of instances running on the same machine.
member.param: The maximum instances per machine.
member.returns: The set with the specified maximum instances per machine.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Admin.ServiceGrid.Space.SpaceDeployment.MaxInstancesPerZone(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of instances per zone.
On partitioned topology with backups topology, controls that a primary and a backup won't run on the same zone if set to 1. Note, for each zone this will have to be set.
On a non partitioned with backups topology, controls the maximum number of instances running on he same zone.
member.param: The zone to set maximum instances for.
The maximum instances per zone.
member.returns: The set with the specified maximum instances per zone for a specific zone.

member.summary: Adds a zone where the processing unit is allowed to be deployed on.
member.param: The zone in which the processing unit is allowed to be deployed on.
member.returns: The set with the allowed zone to be deployed on.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.IReadOnlySpaceProxy.ReadByIds(System.Type,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Read objects from the space matching their IDs and the specified class.
Note, if the space is partitioned and the Class defines a specific property for its routing value (which means that the ID property is not used for routing), the operation will broadcast to all partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.IReadOnlySpaceProxy.ReadByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary:
Read objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class and routing key.
Note, if routing key is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The routing key of the provided object IDs.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.IReadOnlySpaceProxy.ReadByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object,GigaSpaces.Core.ITransaction)

Read objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class and routing key.
Note, if routing key is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The routing key of the provided object IDs.
The transaction which this operation will participate in.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.IReadOnlySpaceProxy.ReadByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object,GigaSpaces.Core.ITransaction,GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers)
member.summary:
Read objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class type and routing key, with the provided .
Note, if routing key is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The routing key of the provided object IDs.
The transaction which this operation will participate in.
The read modifier to use (One or several of ).
member.returns: An reference containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.IReadOnlySpaceProxy.ReadByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary:
Read objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class and the routing keys.
Note, the IDs array and routing keys array are correlated and should be of the same size. The routing key of ID i in the IDs array is the element at position i in the routing keys array. If routingKeys is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The object routing keys array.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class type.
The object IDs array.
The object routing keys array.
The transaction which this operation will participate in.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.param: Type of requested entry.
ID of requested entry.
member.returns: Result entry from space (null if not found).

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.TakeByIds(System.Type,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Take (remove) objects from the space matching their IDs and the specified class.
Note, if the space is partitioned and the Class defines a specific property for its routing value (which means that the ID property is not used for routing), the operation will broadcast to all partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.TakeByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary:
Take (remove) objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class and routing key.
Note, if routing key is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The routing key of the provided object IDs.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.TakeByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object,GigaSpaces.Core.ITransaction)
member.summary:
Take (remove) objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class and routing key.
Note, if routing key is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The routing key of the provided object IDs.
The transaction which this operation will participate in.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.TakeByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object,GigaSpaces.Core.ITransaction,GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers)
member.summary:
Take (remove) objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class type and routing key, with the provided .
Note, if routing key is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The routing key of the provided object IDs.
The transaction which this operation will participate in.
The read modifier to use (One or several of ).
member.returns: An reference containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.TakeByIds(System.Type,System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary:
Take (remove) objects from the space matching their IDs, the specified class and the routing keys.
Note, the IDs array and routing keys array are correlated and should be of the same size. The routing key of ID i in the IDs array is the element at position i in the routing keys array. If routingKeys is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class.
The object IDs array.
The object routing keys array.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

Note, the IDs array and routing keys array are correlated and should be of the same size. The routing key of ID i in the IDs array is the element at position i in the routing keys array. If routingKeys is null and the cluster is partitioned, the operation will broadcast to all of the partitions.
FIFO is not supported by this operation - the results are always ordered in correlation with the input IDs array.
member.param: The class type.
The object IDs array.
The object routing keys array.
The transaction which this operation will participate in.
member.returns: An containing the matched results.
member.exception: The operation had a failure.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.Execute``2(GigaSpaces.Core.Executors.IDistributedSpaceTask{``0,``1})
member.summary:
Executes the task on all the primary space nodes within the cluster (broadcast). The task is executed on each space node with all the results reduced by the operation.
The task can optionally implement that can control if tasks should continue to accumelate or it should break and execute the reduce operation on the results received so far.
The execution actual result will be the reduced result of the execution, or the exception thrown during during the reduce operation. The moderator can be used as a mechanism to listen for results as they arrive.
member.typeparam: Type of distributed task reduced result.
Type of each single space task execution result.
member.param: The distributed space task to execute.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous execution.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.Execute``2(GigaSpaces.Core.Executors.IDistributedSpaceTask{``0,``1},GigaSpaces.Core.ITransaction)
member.summary:
Executes the task on all the primary space nodes within the cluster (broadcast). The task is executed on each space node with all the results reduced by the Reduce operation.
The task can optionally implement that can control if tasks should continue to accumelate or it should break and execute the reduce operation on the results received so far.
The execution actual result will be the reduced result of the execution, or the exception thrown during during the reduce operation. The moderator can be used as a mechanism to listen for results as they arrive.
member.typeparam: Type of distributed task reduced result.
Type of each single space task execution result.
member.param: The distributed space task to execute.
The transaction (if any) under which to work.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous execution.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.BeginExecute``2(GigaSpaces.Core.Executors.IDistributedSpaceTask{``0,``1},GigaSpaces.Core.AsyncCallback{``0},System.Object)
member.summary:
Begins asynchronous execute operation which executes the task on all the primary space nodes within the cluster (broadcast). The task is executed on each space node with all the results reduced by the Reduce operation.
The task can optionally implement that can control if tasks should continue to accumelate or it should break and execute the reduce operation on the results received so far.
The execution actual result will be the reduced result of the execution, or the exception thrown during during the reduce operation. The moderator can be used as a mechanism to listen for results as they arrive.
member.typeparam: Type of distributed task reduced result.
Type of each single space task execution result.
member.param: The distributed space task to execute.
The method to be called when the asynchronous operation is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous execution.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.Change``1(``0,GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeSet)
member.summary:
Changes an existing object in space, returning a change result which provides details of the operation affect. The change operation is designed for performance optimization, By allowing to change an existing object unlike with regular updating write operation which usually requires reading the object before applying to update to it. As part of the optimization, when the operation is replicated, on a best effort it will try to replicate only the required data which is needed to apply the changes on the entry in the replicated target.
Modifiers can be used to specify behavior of the change operation, by default uses the modifier.
member.param: Query to search by.
Changes to apply to the matched entry.
member.returns: A containing the details of the change operation affect.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy.Change``1(``0,GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeSet,GigaSpaces.Core.ITransaction)

member.param: Query to search by.
Changes to apply to the matched entry.
The transaction (if any) under which to work.

member.summary: Acts as a callback for that accept eviction commands.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.IEvictionFacade`1.Evict(`0[])
member.summary:
Evict cache entries, the cache implementation must evict the cache entries that correlates to the supplied keys.
Calling this method may assume thread safetly only if it is synchroniously through the thread that called the eviction strategy methods. Otherwise, for instance a background timer thread that evict items from the cache on a timely basis, a call to must be called to ensure no concurrent modifications are being done while evicting.
member.param: Array of keys of which to evict from the cache

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.IEvictionFacade`1.EvictAll
member.summary:
Evict all the items in the cache, the cache implementation must evict all the cache entries.
Calling this method may assume thread safetly only if it is synchroniously through the thread that called the eviction strategy methods. Otherwise, for instance a background timer thread that evict items from the cache on a timely basis, a call to must be called to ensure no concurrent modifications are being done while evicting.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.IEvictionFacade`1.LockStorage
member.summary: Locks the storage, any concurrent operation will block until is called.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.IEvictionFacade`1.UnlockStorage
member.summary: Unlock the storage, A call to this method should follow a previous call.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.LfuSegmentEvictionStrategyBuilder
member.summary: Least frequently used based eviction strategy builder

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.LfuSegmentEvictionStrategyBuilder.DefaultTouchThreshold
member.summary: Specify default value for the touch threshold

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.LfuSegmentEvictionStrategyBuilder.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Construct the builder
member.param: Local Cache sizelimit (Of all the segments)
How many entries to evict from cache when an eviction is required
Timespan between preiodic cache clears, each time this time span passes the local cache will be cleared

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.Eviction.LfuSegmentEvictionStrategyBuilder.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Double)
member.summary: Construct the builder
member.param: Local Cache sizelimit (Of all the segments)
How many entries to evict from cache when an eviction is required
Timespan between preiodic cache clears, each time this time span passes the local cache will be cleared

When the number of objects in the cache exceeds this threshold, each time an object is accessed at the cache, the method of the eviction strategy will be called. Before the threshold is exceeded the method will not called thus improving the performance of the cache when it is not near its size limit because eviction is not likely to occur. The threshold is a number between 0 and 1 which represents a capacity out of the size limit, this is done by the following formula: touchThreshold * sizeLimit.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.SynchronizeWithRemoteSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to synchronize the local cache entries state with the remote space. Meaning, if an entry is stored in the local cache and the same entry is updated in the remote space, whether is should be updated in the local cache as well.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.SynchronizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the local cache synchronization mode, affects only if is enabled.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.NumberOfSegments
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of segments to construct inside the local cache storage.
Increasing this value decreased concurrency bottlenecks but increases storage overhead.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.SynchronizeBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of entries to recieve in each synchronization with remote space.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.SynchronizeBatchTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time allowed between synchronization cycles.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.DisconnectionDetectionTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time between disconnection detection.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.IdBasedLocalCacheConfig.CachedTypes
member.summary:
Gets or sets the types that will be stored in the local cache.
The cached types support inheritance, there is no need to add two types to the list if one inherits from the other.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalViewConfig
member.summary: A configuration object use to configure creation of a local view.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalViewConfig.BatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the local view batch size which will be used for synchronizing the view with the remote space. Null value indicates that the default value will be used.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalViewConfig.BatchTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the local view batch timeout (i.e. maximum time the server will batch entries before updating the client. Null value indicates that the default value will be used.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalViewConfig.MaxDisconnectionDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed duration to hold stale data in the view before restarting the view. This occurrs when the connection is lost with the remote space for the specified duration. Null value indicates that the default value will be used.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Cache.LocalViewConfig.InitialSynchronizationTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial synchronization process timeout, once exceeded the process is considered failed and will be retried (Defaults to 5 minutes).

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema the cluster operates under. Usually maps to a Space cluster schema. Can have null value which means that it was not set.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance id of the specific cluster member. Can have null value which means that it was not set and should not be taken into account.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.BackupId
member.summary: Gets or sets the backup id of the specific cluster member. Can have null value which means that it was not set and should not be taken into account.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.NumberOfInstances
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of primary instances that are running within the cluster. Note, this are the number of primary instances. Each instance might also have one or more backups. Can have null value which means that it was not set and should not be taken into account.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.NumberOfBackups
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of backups that each primary instance will have in a cluster. Can have null value which means that it was not set and should not be taken into account.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical name of the cluster.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ClusterInfo.RunningNumber
member.summary:
Gets a "running" number represented by the cluster info. Some examples:
1. NumberOfInstances=2, numberOfBackups=0, instanceId=1: RunningNumber = 0. 2. NumberOfInstances=2, numberOfBackups=0, instanceId=2: RunningNumber = 1. 3. NumberOfInstances=2, numberOfBackups=1, instanceId=1, backupId=0: RunningNumber = 0. 4. NumberOfInstances=2, numberOfBackups=1, instanceId=1, backupId=1: RunningNumber = 1. 5. NumberOfInstances=2, numberOfBackups=1, instanceId=2, backupId=0: RunningNumber = 2. 6. NumberOfInstances=2, numberOfBackups=1, instanceId=2, backupId=1: RunningNumber = 3.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.ILease
member.summary: Defines a type of object that is issued by the lease grantor and returned to the lease holder.
member.remarks: Particular instances of the Lease type will be created by the grantors of a lease, and returned to the holder of the lease as part of the return value from a call that allocates a leased resource. The call that requests a leased resource will typically include a requested duration for the lease. If the request is for a particular duration, the lease grantor is required to grant a lease of no more than the requested period of time. A lease may be granted for a period of time shorter than that requested.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ILease.Cancel
member.summary: Used by the lease holder to indicate that it is no longer interested in the resource or information held by the lease.
member.exception: The lease being cancelled is unknown to the lease grantor.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.ILease.Renew(System.Int64)
member.summary: Used to renew a lease for an additional period of time.
member.param: A period of time, specified in milliseconds.
member.exception: The lease being cancelled is unknown to the lease grantor.
The lease grantor is unable or unwilling to renew the lease.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.ILease.Expiration

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.SpaceFifoGroupingIndexAttribute
P:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.SpaceFifoGroupingIndexAttribute.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets a fifo grouping index path. The path specifies which property path is used for fifo grouping index. If none is defined - the property itself is used for fifo grouping index.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.SpaceFifoGroupingPropertyAttribute
member.summary:
Specifies that the annotated property will be used as the fifo grouping property. If defined, the or modifiers can be used to return all space entries that match the selection template in FIFO order.
Different values of the FG property define groups of space entries that match each value - FIFO ordering exists within each group and not between different groups.
There can be only one FIFO Grouping property per type. FIFO grouping property can be declared on a nested property, by specifying a path as done for SpaceIndex.
For example: 1. To declare the 'symbolName' property as fifoGroupingProperty
[SpaceFifoGroupingProperty] public String SymbolName { get; set; }
gigaSpace.take(new Symbol("symbolA"), timeout, )
will return all the space entries with symbolName equal to "symbolA" in FIFO order.
2. To index 'personalInfo.name':
[spaceFifoGroupingProperty(path = "name")] public Info PersonalInfo { get; set; }

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.SpaceFifoGroupingPropertyAttribute.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the fifo grouping property path. The path specifies which property path is used for fifo grouping. If none is defined - the property itself is used for fifo grouping.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Document.SpaceDocument
member.summary:
Represents a document which can be stored and retrieved from the space.
A document is a collection of properties (which are name-value pairs) associated with a type. A property name is a string. A property value can be of any type, but it is usually either a scalar (e.g. int, String, Date, etc.), a set of properties , or an array/collection or scalars or maps.
Documents of the same type can have different properties, which provides more dynamic schema than concrete types.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Logging.TraceLogger
member.summary: The TraceLogger sends all logging to the System.Diagnostics.TraceSource built into the .net framework.
member.remarks:
Logging can be configured in the system.diagnostics configuration section.
If logger doesn't find a source name with a full match it will use source names which match the namespace partially. For example you can configure from all castle components by adding a source name with the name "Castle".
If no portion of the namespace matches the source named "Default" will be used.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Logging.TraceLogger.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Build a new trace logger based on the named TraceSource
member.param: The name used to locate the best TraceSource. In most cases comes from the using type's fullname.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Logging.TraceLogger.#ctor(System.String,GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Logging.LoggerLevel)
member.summary: Build a new trace logger based on the named TraceSource
member.param: The name used to locate the best TraceSource. In most cases comes from the using type's fullname.
The default logging level at which this source should write messages. In almost all cases this default value will be overridden in the config file.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Logging.TraceLogger.CreateChildLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new child logger. The name of the child logger is [current-loggers-name].[passed-in-name]
member.param: The Subname of this logger.
member.returns: The New ILogger instance.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType
member.summary: Enumeration used to mark the component's lifestyle.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Undefined
member.summary: No lifestyle specified.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Singleton
member.summary: Singleton components are instantiated once, and shared between all clients.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Thread
member.summary: Thread components have a unique instance per thread.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Transient
member.summary: Transient components are created on demand.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Pooled
member.summary: Optimization of transient components that keeps instance in a pool instead of always creating them.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Custom
member.summary: Any other logic to create/release components.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.LifestyleType.PerWebRequest
member.summary: PerWebRequest components are created once per Http Request

member.param: The interface type to proxy.
Additional interface types to proxy.
The proxy generation options.

member.remarks: Implementers should return a proxy type for the specified interface(s) that delegate all executions to the specified interceptors and uses an instance of the interface as their targets (i.e. ), rather than a class. All classes should then implement interface, to allow interceptors to switch invocation target with instance of another type implementing called interface.

member.summary: Here we try to match a constructor argument to its value. Since we can't get the values from the assembly, we use some heuristics to get it. a/ we first try to match all the properties on the attributes by name (case insensitive) to the argument b/ if we fail we try to match them by property type, with some smarts about convertions (i,e: can use Guid for string).

member.summary: Provides an extension point that allows proxies to choose specific interceptors on a per method basis.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.IInterceptorSelector.SelectInterceptors(System.Type,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Interceptor.IInterceptor[])
member.summary: Selects the interceptors that should intercept calls to the given .
member.param: The type declaring the method to intercept.
The method that will be intercepted.
All interceptors registered with the proxy.
member.returns: An array of interceptors to invoke upon calling the .
member.remarks: This method is called only once per proxy instance, upon the first call to the . Either an empty array or null are valid return values to indicate that no interceptor should intercept calls to the method. Although it is not advised, it is legal to return other implementations than these provided in . A better way to do this, is by passing all the required interceptors to the appropriate method of . You can use this method to influence the order in which interceptors will be called, by reordering the array. Returning an array containing null references (Nothing in Visual Basic) is not legal, and will result in a runtime exception.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope.SaveAssembly
member.summary: Saves the generated assembly with the name and directory information given when this instance was created (or with the and current directory if none was given).

remarks.para: This method stores the generated assembly in the directory passed as part of the module information specified when this instance was constructed (if any, else the current directory is used). If both a strong-named and a weak-named assembly have been generated, it will throw an exception; in this case, use the overload.
If this was created without indicating that the assembly should be saved, this method does nothing.

member.exception: Both a strong-named and a weak-named assembly have been generated.
member.returns: The path of the generated assembly file, or null if no file has been generated.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerator.CreateInterfaceProxyWithoutTarget``1(GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.Core.Interceptor.IInterceptor)
member.summary: Creates proxy object intercepting calls to members of interface on target object generated at runtime with given .
member.typeparam: Type of the interface which will be proxied.
member.param: The interceptors called during the invocation of proxied methods.
member.returns: Object proxying calls to members of types on generated target object.
member.exception: Thrown when given object is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Thrown when given is not an interface type.
member.remarks: Since this method uses an empty-shell implementation of interfaces to proxy generated at runtime, the actual implementation of proxied methods must be provided by given implementations. They are responsible for setting return value (and out parameters) on proxied methods. It is also illegal for an interceptor to call , since there's no actual implementation to proceed with. This method uses implementation to generate a proxy type. As such caller should expect any type of exception that given implementation may throw.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference.ResetScope
member.summary: Resets the used for deserialization to a new scope.
member.remarks: This is useful for test cases.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference.SetScope(GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope)
member.summary: Resets the used for deserialization to a given .
member.param: The scope to be used for deserialization.
member.remarks: By default, the deserialization process uses a different scope than the rest of the application, which can lead to multiple proxies being generated for the same type. By explicitly setting the deserialization scope to the application's scope, this can be avoided.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference.ModuleScope
member.summary: Gets the used for deserialization.
member.value: As has no way of automatically determining the scope used by the application (and the application might use more than one scope at the same time), uses a dedicated scope instance for deserializing proxy types. This instance can be reset and set to a specific value via and .

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Internal.Pbs.PbsStreamResource.FlipGuidBytes(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method assists in Guid/Uuid translation between CLR/JVM. In .Net, there's a difference between the storage and display. For example, if the ToString() method returns {01020304-0506-0708-090a-0b0c0d0e0f10}, the ToByteArray() method will return {04,03,02,01,06,05,08,07,09,0a,0b,0c,0d,0e,0f,10}. This method flips the relevant bytes so those outputs are aligned.
member.param: Set to true if the GUID is written to the java side, false if red from the java side

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers
member.summary: Reperesents modifiers for space read operations.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.None
member.summary: Use operation default behavior.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Allows read operations to have visibility of entities that are not write-locked or exclusively-locked by active transactions. This modifier cannot be used together with: DirtyRead, ReadCommitted

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.DirtyRead
member.summary: Allows non-transactional read operations to have full visibility of the entities in the space, including entities that are exclusively-locked. This modifier cannot be used together with: RepeatableRead, ReadCommitted

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.ExclusiveReadLock
member.summary: Allows read operations to have exclusive visibility of entities that are not locked by active transactions.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Allows read operations to have visibility of already committed entities, regardless of the fact that these entities might be updated (with a newer version) or taken under an uncommitted transaction. This modifier cannot be used together with: RepeatableRead, DirtyRead

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.IgnorePartialFailure
member.summary: Affects batch operations. The modifier will cause partial results to be returned instead of throwing when not all of the requested number of entries are returned and one or more cluster members are not available.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.Fifo
member.summary: Indicates the operation should comply with First-In-First-Out order. Can only be used if the relevant type is set with

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.FifoGroupingPoll
member.summary: The modifier will cause a group fifo poll based on the passed template. The template must have a property marked with the .

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ReadModifiers.MemoryOnlySearch
member.summary: Search for matching entries in cache memory only (do not use the underlying EDS).

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers
member.summary: Reperesents modifiers for space take operations.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers.None
member.summary: Use operation default behavior.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers.IgnorePartialFailure
member.summary: Affects batch operations. The modifier will cause partial results to be returned instead of throwing when not all of the requested number of entries are returned and one or more cluster members are not available.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers.EvictOnly
member.summary: A modifier passed to take operations. The modifier will cause eviction from cache of the selected entries - relevant for LRU cache policy only

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers.Fifo
member.summary: Indicates the operation should comply with First-In-First-Out order. Can only be used if the relevant type is set with

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers.FifoGroupingPoll
member.summary: The modifier will cause a group fifo poll based on the passed template. The template must have a property marked with the .

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.TakeModifiers.MemoryOnlySearch
member.summary: Search for matching entries in cache memory only (do not use the underlying EDS).

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers
member.summary: Represents modifiers for space write operations.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.None
member.summary: Use operation default behavior.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.WriteOnly
member.summary: Only write is valid - if the entry exists in the space, a will be thrown. This modifier cannot be used together with: UpdateOnly, UpdateOrWrite, PartialUpdate

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.UpdateOnly
member.summary: Only update is valid - if the entry does not exist in the space, a will be thrown. This modifier cannot be used together with: WriteOnly, UpdateOrWrite

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.PartialUpdate
member.summary: Partial update will be performed - fields with null values in the new entry will be ignored. This modifier cannot be used together with: WriteOnly, UpdateOrWrite

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.UpdateOrWrite
member.summary: Both update and write are valid - if the entry exists in the space it will be updated, otherwise it will be written. This modifier cannot be used together with: UpdateOnly, WriteOnly, PartialUpdate

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.NoReturnValue
member.summary: The method will not return a value. This improves performance due to reduction of the overhead of creating the result.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.ReturnPrevOnUpdate
member.summary: Determines if an update operation should return the previous entry in the lease.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.WriteModifiers.OneWay
member.summary: Operation is executed in one way mode, meaning no return value will be provided. Using this mode provides no guarantee whether the operation succeeded or not, the only guarantee is that the operation was successfully written to the local network buffer. As a result, using this modifier will cause the operation not to guarantee automatic fail-over if the primary space instance failed, and it cannot be done under a transaction. When used with an auto generated id space entry, the local entry instance will not be updated with the generated id as this is done on the server. The same applies for version property.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeModifiers
member.summary: Represents modifiers for space change operations.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeModifiers.None
member.summary: Use operation default behavior.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeModifiers.OneWay
member.summary: Operation is executed in one way mode, meaning no return value will be provided. Using this mode provides no guarantee whether the operation succeeded or not, the only guarantee is that the operation was successfully written to the local network buffer. As a result, using this modifier will cause the operation not to guarantee automatic fail-over if the primary space instance failed, and it cannot be done under a transaction.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeModifiers.MemoryOnlySearch
member.summary: Search for matching entries in cache memory only (do not use the underlying external data source). However, any changes done on the matches entries will propagate to the underlying external data source.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.ChangeModifiers.ReturnDetailedResults
member.summary: Return details results meaning the should contain data, otherwise only the number of changed entries will be returned as a result which can be accessed via the .

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Exceptions.InactiveSpaceException
member.summary: This exception thrown when attempting to access an inactive space which runs as a backup of primary space. As long as the the primary space is alive, clients cannot access the backup space directly to perform space operation. When using clustered proxy, the operation will be transparently routed to the active primary space. The PrimarySpaceName property return the primary space name the user should access.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Exceptions.WriteMultipleException
member.summary:
Thrown when operation fails due to partial or complete failure, either in single or clustered space topologies.
The exception contains an array of write results where each result in the array is either a lease or an exception upon failure, the result index corresponds to the entry index in the array of entries which are being written/updated.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Filters.FilterOperationDelegateInvoker
member.summary:
A filter operation delegate invoker, invoking a method associated with the given operation code. For single invocation (see Process(SpaceContext,ISpaceFilter,FilterOperation)) support the following different structures:
A no op method callback. For example Test() A single parameter. The parameter can either be an or the actual template object wrapped by the entry. If using actual types, this delegate will filter out all the types that are not assignable to it. For example: Test(ISpaceFilterEntry entry) or Test(SimpleMessage message). Two parameters. The first one maps to the previous option, the second one is the . Three parameters. The first two maps to the previous option, the third one is a .
For multiple invocation (see Process(SpaceContext,ISpaceFilter,ISpaceFilter,FilterOperation)) support the following different structures: A no op method callback. For example Test() A single parameter. The parameter can either be an or the actual template object wrapped by the entry. If using actual types, this delegate will filter out all the types that are not assignable to it. For example: Test(ISpaceFilterEntry entry) or Test(SimpleMessage message). Two parameters. The first one maps to the previous option, the second is the same as the first one since multiple entries always have two entries (mainly for update operations). Three parameters. The first two maps to the previous option, the second one is the . Four parameters. The first three maps to the previous option, the third one is a .

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Filters.ISpaceFilter
member.summary:
A filter is a special hook point inside the engine that enables integration with external systems or implementation of user defined logic. The filter has a simple life-cycle: it initializes itself in the init() method, processes events in its process() method and finally cleans resources on close(). The process() method is called by the engine when an event that matches the filter's Operation Code. The possible codes are specified by the . Filters are grouped by priorities. Filters with higher priorities are activated closer to the hook point. This means:
* Before filters - filters with lower priorities will be activated first. * After filters - filters with higher priorities will be activated first.
Since filters are activated in sensitive hook points in the engine, they should be careful with performing long blocking calls, such as connecting to databases.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Filters.MethodNameSpaceFilterConfigFactory
member.summary:
A implementation that accepts an object filter with different operation callbacks that are marked using this configurer. For each available operation there is a property that accepts the method name to be invoked if the operation happend. Not setting a callback means that this filter will not listen to the mentioned operation. For example, if the filter has a method called DoSomethingBeforeWrite, the property BeforeWrite will need to be set with DoSomethingBeforeWrite.
The methods marked with an attribute can accept different arguments. Please see for all the different possibilities.
For an object filter adapter that uses attributes please see .

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Persistency.ISqlDataSource.ExecuteBulk(System.Collections.Generic.IList{GigaSpaces.Core.Persistency.BulkItem})
member.summary:
Execute given bulk of operations. Each contains one of the following operation -
WRITE - given object should be inserted to the data store, UPDATE - given object should be updated in the data store, REMOVE - given object should be deleted from the data store
If the implementation uses transactions, all the bulk operations must be executed in one transaction.
member.param: Collection of bulk items to execute

member.summary: Occurs when a new entry is written to the space.

member.summary: Occurs when an entry in the space has been updated.

member.summary: Occurs when an entry's lease has expired.

member.summary: Occurs when any entry-related event occurs.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.DataEventType.Unmatched
member.summary: Occurs when an entry in the space that was suitable for a provided notify template has been updated and as a result is no longer suitable.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.DataEventType.MatchedUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when an entry in the space that wasn't suitable for a provided notify template has been updated and as a result became suitable.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.DataEventType.RematchedUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when an entry in the space that was suitable for a provided notify template has been updated and stayed suitable.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.ComType
member.summary: Lists possible event communication protocols.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.ComType.Unicast
member.summary: Unicast propagation uses TCP unicast communication, which is usually best for a small amount of registered clients. This is the default communication type.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.ComType.Multiplex
member.summary: The same as Unicast in terms of communication protocol, but uses a single client-side multiplexer, which handles all of the dispatching to the different notification listeners.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.LeaseRenewalEventArgs
member.summary: Encapsulates arguments related to lease renewal.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.LeaseRenewalEventArgs.#ctor(System.Exception,System.Int64,GigaSpaces.Core.ILease)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: The exception (if any) that caused the event to be sent
Expiration time of the lease to which event pertains
Lease to which the event pertains

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.LeaseRenewalEventArgs.Exception
member.summary: Returns the exception (if any) that caused the event to be sent.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.LeaseRenewalEventArgs.Expiration
member.summary: Returns the desired expiration time of the lease to which event pertains.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.LeaseRenewalEventArgs.Lease
member.summary: Returns a reference to the lease to which the event pertains.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether events should arrive in the order they are triggered.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to replicate the registration to other spaces in the cluster the belongs to the same replication group.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.TriggerNotifyTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to send notifications from all spaces in the cluster that belongs the same replication group that were triggered by the same template.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.Batch
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Batch Notifications are enabled. If defined, and must be defined as well.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.BatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the batch used when sending notifications to the client.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.BatchTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum elapsed time, in milliseconds, between two batch notifications.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.BatchPendingThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of notifications accumulated at the server before notifications are sent to the client. If not set, is used.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.AutoRenew
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the event session automatic lease renewal is enabled. If defined, must have at least one subscriber.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.AutoRenewLeaseDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the lease period, in milliseconds, used to auto renew the Event Session. This period defines the max time passes between session failure, and the time the failure notifications is received. The parameter value must be bigger than .

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.AutoRenewTotalDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the total period of time, in milliseconds, at which Event Session lease will be auto renewed. Each renewal period will be of .

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.AutoRenewRTT
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that takes to reach the server and return (Round trip time) in milliseconds. This value will be the time the renew request will be sent to the server prior to the end of the current lease.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.GuaranteedNotifications
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to generate notifications that will not be lost during failover.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.Core.Events.EventSessionConfig.DurableNotifications
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to generate notifications that will not be lost during failover and disconnection.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.StorageType
member.summary: Determines how a user defined object will be stored in the space.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.StorageType.Default
member.summary: Storage type will automatically determined by the system.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.StorageType.Object
member.summary: The object will be stored as a Pojo in the space. It will be matchable and readable from any proxy. A compatible class in java must be defined in the space classpath.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.StorageType.Binary
member.summary: The object will be stored in a portable binary format. It will not be deserialized and constructed in the space. It will not be matchable. It will be readable from any proxy.

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.StorageType.BinaryCustom
member.summary: The object will be stored in a binary form, using user-defined serialization or standard serialization, according to the platform of the proxy. It will not be matchable. It will be readable only from proxies of the same platform (Java/.Net/C++).

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.Core.Metadata.StorageType.Document
member.summary: If the object is not part of the built-in inter-operable types, the object will be stored as a SpaceDocument in the space. It will be matchable and readable from a .NET or Java proxy. When placed on built-in inter-operable types, such as Arrays, Lists, Dictionaries and Dynamic Properties, this storage type will be propogated to the items in these collections while the containers them-selves will be stored in their inter-operable form.

Event listener execution can automatically be wrapped in transactions through passing an into the property.
The container can automatically take the notified event data (using ) if the is set to true. If the flag is set to true, can control of the event will be propagated to the event listener if the take operation returned null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event session config that is used to create the that is used for notification registration.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Notify.NotifyEventListenerContainer`1.PerformTakeOnNotify
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the container should take the entry from the space when an event arrives.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Notify.NotifyEventListenerContainer`1.IgnoreEventOnNullTake
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a data event should be raised when the container receives a notification but fails to take the entry. This can happen, for instance, if there are multiple listeners that listen for the same data and use .In that case only one of them will take the entry and the rest will return null, which is probably means the event is irrelevant for those listeners and should not be raised.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Notify.NotifyEventListenerContainer`1.QueuedEventHandling
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether events are processed in the notification thread or queued and processed in different event handler threads.
Using in conjuction with larger than one might break fifo behaviour if fifo is configured by the space or the specific class type. The notification is executed in a resource pool of the proxy that handles notifications, if the notification triggered code takes too long, it can overload the proxy notification resources which can cause notifications evantually to get lost.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Notify.NotifyEventListenerContainer`1.QueuedEventHandlersPoolSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the size of the event handling thread pool, this is relevant when is set to true.
Using in conjuction with larger than one might break fifo behaviour if fifo is configured by the space or the specific class type.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Notify.NotifyEventListenerContainer`1.QueuedEventsSizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the events queue, this is relevant when is set to true. When the queue size is reached, it will block until the size decreases.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1
member.summary:
Event listener container that uses a receive operation handler to poll for events and allows to subscribe to that will be triggered by a successfull receive operation, Usally used in conjuction with the API. This container also allow for transactional reception of messages.
Event reception and listener execution can automatically be wrapped in transactions through passing an into the property.
Actual event listener execution happens in a concurrent asynchronous manner, initially consumers will be created. Dynamic scaling of the number of concurrent consumers can be activated through specifying a value that is higher than the value. The scale is done both ways, scale up when necessary and scale down when some of the invokers are idle. A consumer is considered idle when cycles has passed and it didn't trigger any event, the scaling rate is determined by property, its specifies the rate in which to sample the load of the concurrent consumers for scaling up or down.
Using more than one consumer might break fifo behaviour if fifo is configured by the space or the specific class type, however, this is not take case when using Fifo Grouping.
member.typeparam: Type of data which the container monitors for events.

member.summary: Default value for .

member.summary: Default value for .

member.summary: Default value for .

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.DefaultMaxConcurrentConsumers
member.summary: Default value for .

member.name: F:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.DefaultDynamicScaleSampleRate
member.summary: Default value for .

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.OnBecomeNotPrimary

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout parameter which is passed to the each poll.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.ReceiveBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the batch size parameter which is passed to the when subscribed to batch events.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.ReceiveOperationHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the receive operation handler that will be used in each polling iteration. The receive operation handler executes a polling logic every iteration and any non null return value triggers the event.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.TriggerOperationHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the trigger operation handler that will be used in each polling iteration. The trigger operation handlers executes its logic out side the transacional context and before a transaction is created, doing so allows to reduce the overhead of creating a transaction for each polling operation that might be an idle iteration.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.MinConcurrentConsumers
member.summary: The minimum number of concurrent consumers that polls and then executes events, this number can't be higher than and can't be less than 1.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.MaxConcurrentConsumers
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent consumers, that can be scaled up to on demand, that polls and then executes events, this number can't be less than .

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.DynamicScaleSampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate in which to sample the consumers load for scaling up or down. The number represent every how many polling iterations to sample. The value can't be less than 1.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.IdleIterationsThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of idle polling iterations (A polling operation that didn't trigger an event) that when reached define the consumer as idle. The value can't be less than 1.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.BusyIterationsThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of busy polling iterations (A polling operation that triggered an event) that when reached define the consumer as busy. The value can't be less than 1.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.PollingEventListenerContainer`1.ActiveConcurrentConsumers
member.summary: Gets the currently active concurrent consumers, this number can be anywhere between to

member.summary: Gets or sets the dynamic template provider that determines which entries this container should listen for, the provider will be used in order to create a new template at each polling iteration.
member.remarks: This property cannot be changed when the container is running. To change it, the container, set the new value then it again. This property cannot be set together with

member.summary:
Performs single read operation using under an exclusive read lock. This receive operation handler allows to lock entries so other receive operations won't be able to obtain it (mimics the take operation) but without actually performing a take from the Space.
this receive operation handler must be performed under a transaction.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.Trigger.ITriggerOperationHandler`1
member.summary:
Allows to perform a trigger receive operation which control if the active receive operation will be performed in a polling event container. This feature is mainly used when having polling event operations with transactions where the trigger receive operation is performed outside of a transaction thus reducing the creation of transactions did not perform the actual receive operation.
If the returns a non null value, it means that the receive operation should take place. If it returns a null value, no receive operation will be attempted, thus no transaction will be created.
A trigger operation handler can also control if the object returned from will be used as the template for the receive operation by returning true in . If false is returned, the actual template configured in the polling event container will be used.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.Trigger.ITriggerOperationHandler`1.TriggerReceive(GigaSpaces.Core.IQuery{`0},GigaSpaces.Core.ISpaceProxy,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Allows to perform a trigger receive operation which control if the active receive operation will be performed in a polling event container. This feature is mainly used when having polling event operations with transactions where the trigger receive operation is performed outside of a transaction thus reducing the creation of transactions did not perform the actual receive operation.
If this method returns a non null value, it means that the receive operation should take place. If it returns a null value, no receive operation will be attempted, thus no transaction will be created.
member.param: The template for the receive operation.
The proxy to execute the operation on.
Operation's receive timeout
member.returns: Null value when the receive operation should not be triggered, otherwise a non null value that can also be used as the receive template if is set to true.

member.name: P:GigaSpaces.XAP.Events.Polling.Trigger.ITriggerOperationHandler`1.UseTriggerAsTemplate
member.summary: Gets if the object that return from the operation should be used as the receive template instead of the configured template.

member.name: T:GigaSpaces.Core.SqlQuery`1
member.summary: Represents an Sql-like template you can use to query the space.
member.remarks:
SqlQuery provides an alternative means to query the space besides object matching.
Usage: Construct a SqlQuery instance with a generic type of the desired object type, and the query you want to perform. The query syntax is very similar to the WHERE part of a SQL query. You can specify dynamic parameters in the query using question marks (?), and these values are replaced by the matching fields that were placed using the method.
Main advantages of using SqlQuery: * Extended matching - Object matching means each field is matched using equality if it is not null. Other kinds of matching (greater than, less than, etc.) are not supported in Object matching, but can be implemented using a SqlQuery. * Complex matching - Object matching allows you to match each field only once. If you need to implement a more complex query (say, age > 67 AND gender = male OR age > 65 AND gender=female), you can use a SqlQuery to implement it. * Readability - SQL is a well known standard that many developers are familiar with. Using a SqlQuery makes it easier to understand your query.
Disadvanteges: * Performance - Naturally, some matches are executed quicker using Object matching than SqlQuery. The SqlQuery code is optimized to notice (in most cases) which type of matching is quicker, and behave accordingly. However, the analysis overhead is still an issue when using SqlQuery, so if you have a query that can be implemented using simple matching, you probably shouldn't use SqlQuery.
Behavior: A zero length or null string query will operate as a wild card, meaning all instances of the generic type of the SqlQuery are matched by the query.
Supported in: Read, ReadIfExists, ReadMultiple, Take, TakeIfExists, TakeMultiple, Count, Clear, Notifications, ISpaceIterator.
member.typeparam: Type to be used in the instance.

member.name: M:GigaSpaces.Core.SqlQuery`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new SqlQuery using the specified query and the generic type.
member.param: Query's text. If null, simple matching is executed using the type.
